org.smartfrog.sfcore.security
Class MACData

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.sfcore.security.MACData

public class MACData
extends java.lang.Object

Calculate/check the MAC associated with data in a byte array. The MAC is assumed to belong at the end of the byte array containing the data

Can statically set a default key that will be used for all subsequent created MACData objects

To cope with distributed key update being non-transactional, it will check the MAC with the current and the last key but generates MAC with the latest key only.

setKey

public void setKey(java.security.Key k)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
Set the current key to use for the MAC. Makes the existing current key the last key. The default key is destroyed for this MACData object.

Parameters:
k - the key to use for the MAC
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException

addMAC

public void addMAC(byte[] data,
                   int start,
                   int end)
            throws javax.crypto.ShortBufferException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
Adds a MAC of the data to the byte array following the data

Parameters:
data - - the buffer holding the data for the MAC, and the MAC
start - - inclusive start of data
end - - inclusive end of data, mac added after this
Throws:
javax.crypto.ShortBufferException - - if the buffer is insufficiently long to hold the mac
java.lang.SecurityException - - no key yet provided for MAC calculation

public void checkMAC(byte[] data,

              throws java.lang.SecurityException
validate a mac that is at the end of a piece of byte array data

Parameters:
data - to validate
start - of the data - inclusive
end - of the data - inlcusive, mac present after this
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - - the mac does not match
